title: Time radiation from supernova takes to reach Earth

content.prompt: A supernova explosion occurs at a distance of 2Ã—1020 m from Earth. The supernova simultaneously emits radiation at both visible and x-ray wavelengths. Which of the following statements best describes the time it takes for the two types of radiation from the supernova to reach Earth?

choices.label: The two types of radiation reach Earth at the same time, within a few seconds of the supernova explosion.
The two types of radiation reach Earth at the same time, many years after the supernova explosion.
The two types of radiation reach Earth many years after the supernova explosion, but the visible radiation arrives first due to its shorter wavelength.
The two types of radiation reach Earth many years after the supernova explosion, but the x-ray radiation arrives first due to its shorter wavelength.
